item.title: 亚马逊与 Anthropic 的人工智能合作获得英国竞争监管机构的认可
item.description: 英国竞争监管机构周五表示，亚马逊与初创公司 Anthropic 的人工智能合作项目不会被提交进行更深入的调查，因为它没有引起竞争问题。【原文：UK competition regulator said on Friday Amazon's artificial intelligence partnership with startup Anthropic will not be referred for a deeper probe as it did not raise competition concerns.】

item.title: 欧盟隐私监管机构就密码存储问题对 Meta 公司罚款 9100 万欧元
item.description: 周五，欧盟主要隐私监管机构对社交媒体巨头 Meta 罚款 9100 万欧元（1.015 亿美元），原因是该公司无意中在没有保护或加密的情况下存储了一些用户的密码。【原文：The lead European Union privacy regulator fined social media giant Meta 91 million euros ($101.5 million) on Friday for inadvertently storing some users' passwords without protection or encryption.】

item.title: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局（NHTSA）称梅赛德斯-奔驰美国公司将因发动机熄火风险召回逾 2.7 万辆汽车
item.description: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局周五表示，由于发动机控制单元（ECU）软件可能导致发动机过热或熄火，梅赛德斯-奔驰美国公司将召回2.7万多辆汽车。【原文：Mercedez-Benz USA is recalling more than 27,000 vehicles due to a potential risk of the engine control unit (ECU) software causing the engine to overheat or stall, the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said on Friday.】

item.title: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局（NHTSA）称，丰田将因动力制动辅助系统失灵召回超过 4.2 万辆汽车
item.description: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局（National Highway Traffic Safety Administration）周五表示，丰田汽车公司将召回超过4.2万辆美国汽车，原因是这些汽车的动力制动辅助系统失灵，可能会延长停车距离。【原文：Toyota Motor Corp is recalling over 42,000 U.S. vehicles over loss of power brake assist that can extend the distance required to stop, the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said on Friday.】

item.title: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局（NHTSA）称马自达在美国召回超过 7.7 万辆 MX-5 跑车
item.description: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局周五表示，马自达将在美国召回77670辆跑车，原因是一个软件错误可能导致前安全气囊在碰撞中过度展开。【原文：Mazda is recalling 77,670 sports vehicles in the U.S. over a software error that may cause the front airbags to deploy with excessive force in a crash, the U.S. National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said on Friday.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称，德国财长强调了对德国商业银行收购意大利的担忧
item.description: 据两位熟悉内情的人士透露，德国财政部长最近几天向意大利财政部强调了他对意大利联合信贷银行（UniCredit）恶意收购德国商业银行（Commerzbank）的担忧，这是柏林为阻止恶意收购所做的更广泛努力。【原文：Germany's finance minister has underscored to Italy's Treasury his concerns over any hostile takeover of Commerzbank by Italy's UniCredit in recent days, according to two people familiar with the matter, in a wider bid by Berlin to halt a hostile takeover.】

item.title: 美国降息和中国刺激政策为更多亚洲私募股权交易带来希望
item.description: 业内人士表示，美国降息和中国的市场经济刺激计划将有利于亚洲的私募股权交易，较低的融资成本和较好的市场情绪预计将使退出更加容易。【原文：U.S. interest rate cuts and China's economic stimulus package for markets will be conducive to private equity deals in Asia, with lower funding costs and better market sentiment expected to make exits easier, industry players said.】

item.title: 英国商业信心指数（CBI）称英国零售额增速为 5 月以来最快
item.description: 英国工业联合会（Confederation of British Industry）周五表示，本月英国零售商的销售额实现了自5月份以来的最快增长，并预计10月份的销售额将进一步小幅增长，这与其他较为低迷的消费者情绪调查形成了鲜明对比。【原文：British retailers reported the fastest growth in sales since May this month and see a further modest expansion for October, the Confederation of British Industry said on Friday, in a contrast to other more downbeat surveys of consumer sentiment.】

item.title: 出口占主导地位，美国墨西哥湾沿岸石油价格将成为舞台中心
item.description: 美国原油出口量的增加正在提升墨西哥湾沿岸价格基准的重要性，并刺激休斯顿合同的交易量，削弱了俄克拉荷马州库欣储存中心的重要性。【原文：Rising U.S. crude oil exports are boosting the prominence of Gulf Coast price benchmarks and buoying trading volumes on Houston contracts, eroding the significance of the Cushing, Oklahoma, storage hub.】

item.title: 野禽迁徙开始之际，美国农民呼吁选择疫苗防治禽流感
item.description: 美国农民正在向拜登政府施加越来越大的压力，要求政府允许为鸡、火鸡和牛接种疫苗，以保护它们免受禽流感感染，禽流感已持续三年肆虐鸡群。【原文：U.S. farmers are increasing pressure on the Biden administration to allow vaccinations for chickens, turkeys and cows to protect them from bird flu infections that have devastated flocks for three years.】

item.title: 早间竞价中国加速反弹，美国 PCE 受到关注
item.description: Mike Dolan 展望美国和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan】

item.title: 美联储已就降息达成一致，但即将公布的数据将左右降息步伐
item.description: 美联储上周投票决定将利率下调半个百分点时，并没有达成完全一致的意见，一位政策制定者持反对意见，而经济预测则暗示其他政策制定者至少有点不愿意以过激的举动来启动宽松周期。【原文：The Federal Reserve did not have full consensus when it voted last week to reduce interest rates by half of a percentage point, with one policymaker dissenting and economic projections implying others were at least a bit reluctant to start the easing cycle with an outsized move.】

item.title: 投资者等待关键的通胀报告，期货价格下滑
item.description: 周五，美国股指期货下滑，原因是投资者在一份重要的通胀报告公布前保持谨慎，该报告可能会影响对美联储即将降息幅度的预期。【原文：U.S. stock index futures slipped on Friday, as investors exercised caution ahead of a crucial inflation report which could sway expectations on the size of upcoming interest rate cuts by the Federal Reserve.】

item.title: 欧元区糟糕的数据流不断增加欧洲央行降息的理由
item.description: 本月，欧元区两个最大经济体的通胀放缓幅度超过预期，德国就业市场继续降温，这为欧洲央行下月进一步削减借贷成本提供了充足的理由。【原文：Inflation has eased more than expected in two of the euro zone's biggest economies and the German jobs market has continued to cool this month, adding to an already substantial case for the European Central Bank to cut borrowing costs further next month.】

item.title: 独家报道泰国养老基金拨出 116 亿美元用于全球投资改革
item.description: 泰国 770 亿美元的社会保障基金表现不佳，一位高管告诉路透社，该基金将投资 116 亿美元，进军全球私人资产市场。【原文：Thailand's underperforming $77 billion social security fund will invest $11.6 billion in a new foray into global private assets, an executive told Reuters, part of a strategic overhaul to address its poor returns amid rising demand from an ageing population.】

item.title: 中国 9 月份工厂活动继续下滑
item.description: 由于国内需求疲软和全球贸易壁垒上升继续困扰着这个世界第二大经济体，中国的工厂活动可能在 9 月份连续第五个月保持萎缩。【原文：China's factory activity likely remained in contraction for the fifth consecutive month in September, as weak domestic demand and rising global trade barriers continue to dog the world's second-largest economy.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称，上海和深圳将取消关键性购房限制，以促进市场发展
item.description: 四位知情人士透露，中国大城市上海和深圳正计划取消剩余的主要购房限制，以吸引潜在购房者，支撑其疲软的房地产市场。【原文：Top Chinese cities Shanghai and Shenzhen are planning to lift key remaining restrictions on home purchases to attract potential buyers and shore up their flagging real estate markets, four sources with knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: 消息人士称，德国商业银行和意大利联合信贷银行将于周五上午举行虚拟会议
item.description: 一位直接了解此事的人士告诉路透社，德国商业银行和联合信贷银行周五的会议将在上午举行。【原文：A meeting between Commerzbank and UniCredit on Friday will be held virtually in the morning, a person with direct knowledge of the matter told Reuters.】

item.title: BBVA 和 KKR 建立以气候为重点的战略合作伙伴关系
item.description: 西班牙银行 BBVA 和美国投资者 KKR 周五表示，双方已建立战略合作伙伴关系，重点投资与全球气候驱动的低碳经济转型相关的领域。【原文：Spanish lender BBVA and U.S. investor KKR said on Friday they had formed a strategic partnership focused on investments linked to the world's climate-driven transition to a low-carbon economy.】

item.title: 丰田汽车 8 月份全球产量连续第 7 个月下降
item.description: 受日本台风和认证丑闻以及美国两款运动型多功能车产量暂停的拖累，丰田汽车公司 8 月份的全球产量下降了 11%，连续第七个月下降。【原文：Toyota Motor's global production fell 11% in August, declining for a seventh straight month, dragged lower by a typhoon and a certification scandal in Japan and a pause in output for two sport utility vehicles in the United States.】

item.title: 欧洲 北京出台政策措施
item.description: Stella Qiu 对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Stella Qiu】

item.title: 据英国《金融时报》报道，英特尔和美国将在年底前敲定 85 亿美元的芯片融资计划
item.description: 英国《金融时报》周五援引熟悉讨论情况的人士的话报道称，英特尔和美国政府有望在今年年底前敲定向这家芯片制造商提供 85 亿美元的直接资助。【原文：Intel and the U.S. government are on track to finalise $8.5 billion in direct funding for the chipmaker before the end of the year, the Financial Times reported on Friday, citing people familiar with the discussions.】

item.title: 许多华尔街高管担心特朗普，但又对哈里斯心存戒备
item.description: 许多华尔街高管对支持美国总统大选中的任何一位候选人都持保留态度，他们担心前总统唐纳德-特朗普的政策会损害经济，但又担心副总统卡马拉-哈里斯会过于左倾。【原文：Many Wall Street executives have reservations about backing either candidate in the U.S. presidential election, worried that former President Donald Trump's policies will hurt the economy but wary Vice President Kamala Harris will lean too far left.】

item.title: 日本工厂产量因海外需求疲软和台风影响而下降
item.description: 路透社周五的一项民意调查显示，受海外需求疲软和当地工厂因台风停工的影响，日本8月份的工业产值可能出现下滑，这些因素可能会削弱整体经济复苏的势头。【原文：Japan's industrial output likely slipped in August, weighed down by weak demand from overseas and local factory suspensions due to a typhoon, factors that could dent momentum in an overall economic recovery, a Reuters poll showed on Friday.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，英特尔拒绝 Arm 公司的产品分工方案
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周四报道，Arm 控股公司就收购英特尔公司产品部门的可能性与英特尔公司进行了接触，但被告知该业务不出售。【原文：Arm Holdings approached Intel about potentially acquiring the company's product division but was told that the business is not for sale, Bloomberg News reported on Thursday.】

item.title: 中国股市将迎来 2008 年以来最好的一周；日本领导层角逐成为焦点
item.description: 随着中国政府推出振兴经济的巨额刺激计划，中国股市将迎来自2008年以来最好的一周，亚洲股市也因此升至两年半以来的高点，而油价的大幅下跌则预示着全球通货紧缩将得到缓解。【原文：Chinese stocks are headed for the best week since 2008 as Beijing rolled out a huge stimulus package to revive the economy, lifting Asian shares to 2-1/2-year highs, while a sharp fall in oil prices bodes well for disinflation globally.】

item.title: 斯里兰卡保持利率稳定，等待新总统明确政策
item.description: 斯里兰卡央行周五维持利率不变，与预期一致，因为这个岛国在选出新总统带领其走出数十年来最严重的金融危机之后，正等待政策的明朗化。【原文：Sri Lanka's central bank kept interest rates unchanged on Friday in line with expectations as the island nation waits for policy clarity after electing a new president to steer it out of the worst financial crisis in decades.】

item.title: 中国乐观情绪提振美元走势，风险敏感型货币受到提振
item.description: 周五，美元走势摇摆不定，有望连续第四周下跌，因为投资者在权衡美国数据以衡量降息步伐的同时，中国的一系列刺激措施使对风险敏感的货币保持高位。【原文：The dollar wobbled on Friday, poised for a fourth straight week of declines as investors weighed U.S. data to gauge the pace of interest rate cuts, while China's spree of stimulus measures kept risk-sensitive currencies aloft.】

item.title: 8 月中国工业利润增速重回下降通道
item.description: 周五的官方数据显示，中国 8 月份的工业利润再次出现大幅萎缩。【原文：China's industrial profits swung back to a sharp contraction in August, official data showed on Friday, adding to a recent spate of bleak readings that point to mounting pressure on the economy.】

item.title: 机队和座位陈旧，供应问题阻碍印度航空扭亏为盈
item.description: 塔塔集团（Tata Group）以 24 亿美元的价格收购印度航空公司两年后，重新装备老化的机队、零部件短缺和持续的航班延误阻碍了这家前国有航空公司成为 "世界级航空公司 "的目标。【原文：Two years after Tata Group took control of Air India in a $2.4 billion deal, re-kitting an ageing fleet amid parts shortages and persistent flight delays stand in the way of the former state-owned carrier's intent to become "a world class airline".】
